sections.summary: Moving Averages smooth out price action to reveal the true trend. They are the 'Line in the Sand' between Bull and Bear markets. The SMA (Simple) is slow and steady; the EMA (Exponential) is fast and reactive.
sections.deep_dive: The 200-Day SMA is the institutional dividing line. Above it, big money buys dips. Below it, they sell rallies. The 'Golden Cross' (50-Day crossing above 200-Day) signals a long-term bull market start; the 'Death Cross' signals a crash.
sections.council_debate: {"geopolitics": "Political news creates noise (spikes). Moving averages filter this noise. A Geopolitical crisis is only significant if it breaks the 200-Day SMA. Otherwise, it's just a buying opportunity.", "macro": "In a recession, the 200-Day SMA acts as a ceiling of resistance. Every rally to the 200-Day is a trap. In an expansion, it acts as a floor of support.", "quant": "Trend Following strategies use EMA crossovers (e.g., 9-EMA vs 21-EMA) to generate automatic buy/sell signals. This removes human bias. The 'Slope' of the moving average determines the conviction sizing.", "technical": "Price returning to the mean (Mean Reversion) is a law of physics. If price is 20% above the 200-Day SMA, it is 'stretched' like a rubber band and will snap back. We fade extremes.", "policy": "Central bank liquidity pumps usually keep price above the 50-Day EMA. When liquidity is withdrawn, the 50-Day breaks first, warning of a regime change before the lagging economic data confirms it.", "tech": "High-Frequency Trading (HFT) algos front-run these levels. They will defend the 200-Day SMA aggressively. If it breaks, stop-loss cascades are triggered, creating a 'Liquidity Vacuum' down.", "gms_conclusion": "The 50-Week SMA is our 'God Level' for long-term trends. Respect the trend until it bends."}
sections.forecast_risks: Whipsaws in chopping markets. Moving averages are useless in sideways ranges. They only work in trending environments. You will bleed to death from false signals in a flat market.
sections.gms_conclusion: The 50-Week SMA is our 'God Level' for long-term trends. Respect the trend until it bends.
